metadata.title: NLPD DG extends Eid-ul-Azha greetings, hails national unity and recent victory

content.article_body: ISLAMABAD, Jun 7 (APP): Director General of the National Language Promotion Department (NLPD), Professor Dr. Muhammad Saleem Mazhar, warmly extended heartfelt Eid-ul-Azha greetings to the people of Pakistan and the global Muslim community, commemorating the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha 1446 Hijri. In his Eid message, Dr. Mazhar said, "Eid-ul-Azha on June 7, 2025, holds special pride for the people of Pakistan as it has brought added joy and honor to the nation." He noted that Pakistan recently achieved a significant victory on the global stage, enhancing its stature among the international community. He praised the exemplary national unity demonstrated during this period, stating that the entire nation deserves congratulations for standing together in solidarity. "I pray that Allah preserves this spirit of unity and keeps Pakistan and its people dignified and strong among the nations of the world," he added. Dr. Mazhar concluded his message with warm Eid greetings, wishing peace, progress, and continued unity for the country.
